intro: Onosmodium molle subsp. subsetosum, commonly known as the hairy onosmodium, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its soft, hairy leaves and small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is valued for its ornamental qualities. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and threatened species in some areas.
